dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model
Class DCtxt

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.DCtxt
All Implemented Interfaces:
IModelConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
RCtxt
public class DCtxt
extends java.lang.Object
implements IModelConstants

This is the public interface to access the configuration of a DataModel.

Sub-Classes

Most functionality of a context is provided by classes that can be accessed via public variables of the DCtxt class:

  • opt: Options to configure this context and all context created via this context
  • any: Functions that apply to all kinds of nodes
  • attr: Functions to gain access to AUTOSAR node attributes
  • var: Functions that apply to variables and list of variables
  • ref: Functions that apply to references
  • ctr: Functions that apply to containers
  • chc: Functions that apply to choices
  • xpath: Functions to select nodes and values via XPath expressions
    • attr: Functions to query and set attributes.

Functionality

This class provides non node kind specific navigation (see: Navigation) like: 
 List<DCtxt> children = ctxt.to( "Path/To/the/rightPlace" ).toParent().getChildren()
path manipulation functions: 
 getPath()
 getPath( String <type> )
 getPathWithoutType( String <type> )
 ...
Transaction support: 
 startTransaction( <label> )
 finishTransaction()
Temporary model and merge:

A new temporary DataModel can be created with the method create().

Nodes from another model represented by an other DCtxt can be merged into this model with merge(DCtxt, Map, APIOperationStatus) and merge(List, Map, APIOperationStatus): 

 EcuConfigContext.getInstance().getDCtxt().merge( rctxt, options, status );
Behaviour with non-existing nodes

It is possible to select nodes by XPath expressions that do not exist. If you use such nodes in XPath expressions and try to evalute them in a DCtxt, the XPath engine implicitly assumes values for the nodes even if the nodes do not exist. There are several reasons why a node can be not existing:

  • really not existing nodes (nodes with EXISTING = false in the schema file, or wrong paths arguments)
  • disabled nodes (OPTIONAL disabled node, nodes where the enablement is calculated based on other parameters)

When trying to access the first type of non-existing nodes, the DCtxt always returns null.

When trying to access disabled nodes, the return value depends on the option 'ExistingNodesOnly'. This option can be queried by 

 container.opt.getExistingNodesOnly()

If the option ExistingNodesOnly is set to true, only existing and enabled nodes can be accessed. The DCtxt returns null when trying to access a disabled node.

If the option ExistingNodesOnly is set to false, then also disabled nodes can be queried by using 

 ctxt.get(String path)

It is recommended to check the existence of a node before trying to acces it by using: 

 ctxt.isExisting(String path)

In conjunction with the RCtxt class that allows to parse files into into a DataModel this functionality can be used to update the ECU configuration of a project from files or to write the configuration or parts of it to files: 

 APIOperationStatus status = APIOperationStatus.getOkStatus();
 RCtxt rctxt = RCtxt.create( new Location( new File( "Dem.xdm" ) ) );
 rctxt.load( EcuConfigContext.getInstance().getDCtxt(), null, status );
 rctxt.setLocation( new Location( new File( "Dem.arxml" ), "asc:3.1" ) );
 rctxt.save( EcuConfigContext.getInstance().getDCtxt(), null, status );
and debugging functionality that allows to print the sub-tree of the context and single nodes to the debugging device: 
 printTree()
 print()
 print( List<DCtxt> contexts )
 toString( String path )
 ....

MERGE_SOURCE

public static final java.lang.String MERGE_SOURCE
Use as mergeOption for merge(DCtxt, Map, APIOperationStatus) and merge(List, Map, APIOperationStatus) to set the value of the IMPORT_INFO that describes which parameters came from the same source.

create

public static DCtxt create()
Creates a new empty DataModel.

The return DCtxt is created with options Opt.OPT_USE_NODE_OPERATION|Opt.OPT_NO_SCHEMA| Opt.OPT_ONLY_EXISTING|Opt.OPT_MARK_CALCULATED.

Returns:
DCtxt pointing to the root node of the model.
Since:
11

merge

public void merge(DCtxt node,
                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> mergeOptions,
                  APIOperationStatus status)
Merges a node tree (that must reside in an other model as the model to which this DCtxt belongs) into this model beneath the same path beneath which they can be found in the original model. If Opt.OPT_NO_SCHEMA is not set the target model (the one at which this method is called) must contain a schema (parameter definition) for importer configuration nodes. If no schema is available in this case a warning is added to the handed in status.

Parameters:
node - The node that should be merged into the current model
mergeOptions - can be used to customize the merge process
status - if errors or warnings occur during the merge process they are added beneath this APIOperationStatus object
Since:
11

merge

public void merge(java.util.List<DCtxt> nodes,
                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> mergeOptions,
                  APIOperationStatus status)
Merges nodes (that must reside in an other model as the model to which this DCtxt belongs) into this model beneath the same paths beneath which they can be found in the original model. If Opt.OPT_NO_SCHEMA is not set the target model (the one at which this method is called) must contain a schema (parameter definition) for importer configuration nodes. If no schema is available in this case a warning is added to the handed in status.

Parameters:
nodes - The nodes that should be merged into the current model
mergeOptions - can be used to customize the merge process
status - if errors or warnings occur during the merge process they are added to this APIOperationStatus object
Since:
11s

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
                         throws CtxtException
Get the name of the context node.

Hint: If you want to get the SHORT-NAME of a node, use getShortName() since it might be different from the name, e.g. when the user manually changes the SHORT-NAME via the editor or the SHORT-NAME is changed during an import

Returns:
The name of the context node or null on error
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error
Since:
2008.a

getShortName

public java.lang.String getShortName()
                              throws CtxtException
Returns:
the SHORT-NAME of the context node or null on error or if the context node just does not have a SHORT-NAME. Note that this is e.g. the case for list-nodes and variable data nodes (as defined by autosar, they just do not have a SHORT-NAME; contrary to this, getName() would return a value for list-nodes, which is the DataModel internal name).
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error
Since:
15.0

getKind

public int getKind()
            throws CtxtException
Get the kind of the context-node.

Returns:
The kind of the context-node: Any.UNKNOWN|Any.CTR|Any.CHC|Any.VAR|Any.REF|Any.LST
Throws:
CtxtException - on error
Since:
2008.a

public java.lang.String getType()
                         throws CtxtException

The type or null on error

isExisting

public boolean isExisting()
                   throws CtxtException
Queries if a node exists. A node may decide according to attribute-settings (ENABLE) for example that it does not exists as part of the configuration. This method does not check if the node is valid.

Returns:
true if node is existing
Throws:
CtxtException - on error
Since:
2008.a

                   throws CtxtException

Returns:
true if referenced node is existing
Throws:
CtxtException - on error
Since:
2008.a

isAccessible

public boolean isAccessible(java.lang.String path)
                     throws CtxtException
Queries if a node is accessible. A node may decide according to attribute-settings (ENABLE) for example that it does not exist as part of the configuration. A non existent node is not queryable via Path expressions and therefore not accessible. With option 'setExistingNodesOnly=false' also disabled nodes are accessible.

Returns:
true if referenced node is accessible
Throws:
CtxtException - on error
Since:
12.0

isReadonly

                   throws CtxtException

Returns:
The value of the readonly attribute of the node referenced by the path
Throws:
CtxtException - on error

startTransaction

public boolean startTransaction(java.lang.String label)
                         throws CtxtException
Create a new transaction to which operations are queued until commitTransaction is called. Transactions cannot be nested.

Returns:
false on error
Throws:
CtxtException - in case of an error
